required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Synergy Between PCI With TAXUS and Cardiac Surgery: SYNTAX Extended Survival
clinical_study.official_title: Synergy Between PCI With TAXUS and Cardiac Surgery: SYNTAX Extended Survival

brief_summary.textblock: An investigator-driven, retrospective study to compare long-term survival-data (10-year follow-up) of patients with coronary artery disease (CAD), previously enrolled in the SYNTAX trial, who were randomized to percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) using a paclitaxel (TAXUS) drug-eluting-stent (DES) or coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG).

secondary_outcome.description: Cause-specific death, separated in cardiovascular and non-cardiovascular death with specific causes for cardiovascular deaths.

arm_group.description: Patients which were randomized to undergo CABG.
Patients which were randomized to undergo PCI.
Patients for whom only one treatment option was suitable were included into a parallel, nested registry: the CABG registry for PCI-ineligible patients.
Patients for whom only one treatment option was suitable were included into a parallel, nested registry: the PCI registry for CABG-ineligible patients.

intervention.intervention_name: No intervention will take place for this retrospective and observational study.
intervention.description: No intervention will take place for this retrospective and observational study.

study_pop.textblock: Patients enrolled in the SYNTAX trial and registries had to be diagnosed with three-vessel (3VD) or left main (LM) coronary artery disease. The vessels (diameter ≥1.5 mm and significant stenosis > 50%) deemed important to revascularize were determined by the Heart Team prior to randomization. The group of 3VD consists of patients with significant stenosis in vessels supplying all three major epicardial territories in absence of LM disease, as determined by the site investigators. The group of patients with LM disease consists of patients with a significant stenosis of the left main coronary artery, irrespective of additional vessel disease.

criteria.textblock: Patients which have previously been enrolled in the SYNTAX trial (randomized and registry patients)

overall_official.affiliation: Baylor Scott & White Health, Plano, TX, United States
Mayo Clinic, Rochester, MN, United States
ICPS Ramsay-Generale de Sante, Massy, France
